title: If humans never existed, what’s the next species would most likely develop civilizations? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think bonobos are the most likely. One theory about human development is that they “self domesticated”, giving up violence (on a relative basis of course) for cooperation. Chimps are more violent than bonobos, who settle disputes with sex. Chimps are along the road toward upright walking, opposable thumbs, and large brains as we no doubt were 6 million years ago (although we don’t understand how the ancestors of chimps and bonobos developed over time since 6 million years ago). Orangs are too solitary and gorillas greater gender ratio body sizes is too different than ours (and they are less close to us than chimps and bonobos).
Another great ape seems like the obvious answer.
